page.title: 05TATCHBURY MOUNT
page.content: Tatchbury Mount Hospital is a home for mentally handicapped people. It was a private residence until 1933 when it was sold to Hampshire Area Mental Welfare Authority.{ It is on an {isolated 5 acre site which was {originally an Iron Age fort. { }It houses 260 residents.The use of Tatchbury is going to change in the near future.There is at present a social revolution in the way that we deal with mentally handicapped people. The move is to house patients in small community units. The hospital will still care for the more seriously ill. There is a rumour that the Goverment intends to sell about half of the site for residential building in the near future.
